trans-unit.source: API app metadata
trans-unit.target: API app metadata

trans-unit.source: This section provides additional information about API app metadata that you can customize.
trans-unit.target: This section provides additional information about API app metadata that you can customize.

trans-unit.source: Most of the properties in the *apiapp.json* file, and the files in the *Metadata* folder, affect the way an API app package is presented in the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: Most of the properties in the *apiapp.json* file, and the files in the *Metadata* folder, affect the way an API app package is presented in the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: The following sections explain which properties and files affect API apps when you deploy your code to an API app in your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: The following sections explain which properties and files affect API apps when you deploy your code to an API app in your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: API app ID
trans-unit.target: API app ID

trans-unit.source: The `id` property determines the name of the API app.
trans-unit.target: The `id` property determines the name of the API app.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Namespace
trans-unit.target: Namespace

trans-unit.source: Set the `namespace` property to the domain of your Azure Active Directory tenant.
trans-unit.target: Set the `namespace` property to the domain of your Azure Active Directory tenant.

trans-unit.source: To find your domain, open your browser to the [Azure classic portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/), browse **Active Directory**, and select the **Domains** tab.
trans-unit.target: To find your domain, open your browser to the [Azure classic portal](https://manage.windowsazure.com/), browse **Active Directory**, and select the **Domains** tab.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Dynamic Swagger API definition
trans-unit.target: Dynamic Swagger API definition

trans-unit.source: If the API app can return a dynamic [Swagger](http://swagger.io/) API definition, store the relative URL for a GET request that returns the API definition JSON in the `endpoints.apiDefinition` property.
trans-unit.target: If the API app can return a dynamic [Swagger](http://swagger.io/) API definition, store the relative URL for a GET request that returns the API definition JSON in the `endpoints.apiDefinition` property.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: **Note:** If you are using Swashbuckle to generate a Swagger API definition, HTTP method overloads in your Web API controllers result in duplicate operation ids.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** If you are using Swashbuckle to generate a Swagger API definition, HTTP method overloads in your Web API controllers result in duplicate operation ids.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Customize Swashbuckle-generated operation identifiers](../article/app-service-api/app-service-api-dotnet-swashbuckle-customize.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Customize Swashbuckle-generated operation identifiers](../article/app-service-api/app-service-api-dotnet-swashbuckle-customize.md).

trans-unit.source: Static Swagger API definition
trans-unit.target: Static Swagger API definition

trans-unit.source: To provide a static [Swagger](http://swagger.io/) 2.0 API definition file, store the file in the *Metadata* folder and name the file *apiDefinition.swagger.json*
trans-unit.target: To provide a static [Swagger](http://swagger.io/) 2.0 API definition file, store the file in the *Metadata* folder and name the file *apiDefinition.swagger.json*

trans-unit.source: Leave `endpoints.apiDefinition` out of the *apiapp.json* file or set its value to null.
trans-unit.target: Leave `endpoints.apiDefinition` out of the *apiapp.json* file or set its value to null.

trans-unit.source: If you include both an `endpoints.apiDefinition` URL and an *apiDefinition.swagger.json* file, the URL will take precedence and the file will be ignored.
trans-unit.target: If you include both an `endpoints.apiDefinition` URL and an *apiDefinition.swagger.json* file, the URL will take precedence and the file will be ignored.
